technical.focal_length: 85-135mm for headshots, 50-85mm for environmental portraits, wide aperture lenses preferred (f/1.4-f/2.8)
technical.depth_of_field: Shallow DOF dominant (f/1.4-f/4) for subject isolation, occasionally deep DOF for environmental context
technical.shutter_speed: 1/60s-1/250s for static poses, 1/125s minimum for handheld to avoid camera shake
technical.lighting: Soft, directional lighting preferred - studio strobes, softboxes, natural window light, reflectors for fill
technical.camera_format: Full-frame and medium format for professional work, APS-C acceptable, mirrorless increasingly common

aesthetic.composition: Rule of thirds for eye placement, leading lines toward subject, negative space for impact, tight framing on face/upper body
aesthetic.subject_background: Background secondary to subject - either creamy bokeh, simple textures, or contextual environments that don't compete
aesthetic.tonal_range: Moderate to high contrast emphasizing facial features, careful shadow/highlight balance on skin tones
aesthetic.color_approach: Accurate skin tone reproduction paramount, often warmer color temperature (3200-5600K), muted backgrounds
aesthetic.texture_detail: Sharp focus on eyes essential, skin texture balanced - detailed but flattering, fabric and hair texture secondary

shooting_approach.subject_distance: 3-8 feet typical working distance to avoid perspective distortion, closer for intimate headshots
shooting_approach.angle_perspective: Eye level or slightly above, 45-degree lighting angle common, avoid extreme high/low angles
shooting_approach.subject_relationship: Mix of posed and candid moments, formal business portraits vs intimate personal portraits
shooting_approach.environment: Controlled studio settings, natural outdoor locations, architectural backgrounds, subject's natural environment

context.historical_context: Evolved from painted portraiture traditions, formalized with studio photography in early 1900s, democratized with 35mm cameras
context.key_characteristics: Subject is primary focus, emphasis on capturing personality and character, technical excellence in skin tones and eye sharpness

era_variants.notes: Classical formal poses (1900s-1950s) to casual environmental portraits (1960s+), digital era brought focus stacking and advanced retouching
